arm_group.description: patients with low rectal cancer received robotic-assist resection.
patients with low rectal cancer received laparoscopic-assist resection.
patients with low rectal cancer received open surgery.

brief_summary.textblock:
In this study, the investigators assessed the difference in efficacy and safety among
      robotic-assisted versus laparoscopic versus open abdominoperineal resection for patients
      with low rectal cancer.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of Robotic-assisted Versus Laparoscopic Versus Open Abdominoperineal Resection for Treating Low Rectal Cancer

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients will be eligible for inclusion if their primary tumors is low rectal cancer.

      Eligible patients will be randomly assigned to robotic-assisted (arm A)versus laparoscopic
      (arm B) versus open abdominoperineal resection (arm C).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age between 18-75 years old

          -  Performance status （ECOG）0-1

          -  low rectal carcinoma pathologically

          -  without any pre-operative chemotherapy or radiotherapy

          -  no metastases

          -  suitable for abdominoperineal resection

          -  agreed by patients

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  age below 18 years old or greater than 75 years old

          -  have not pathological diagnosis of rectal carcinoma

          -  stage cT4NxM0 or cT3N2M0

          -  with any pre-operative chemotherapy or raidotherapy

          -  with metastases

          -  unresectable in operation

          -  not agreed by patients

clinical_study.official_title: A Multicentre, Prospective, Randomised, Controlled, Unblinded, Parallel-group Trial of Robotic-assisted Versus Laparoscopic Versus Open Abdominoperineal Resection for the Curative Treatment of Low Rectal Cancer

primary_outcome.measure: the rate of perioperative complication occurrence
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6  months following the surgery of rectal cancer

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: 3-year local recurrence, disease-free and overall survival rates and also operative morbidity and mortality, quality of life and cost-effectiveness

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
